sample_texts: I'm going to the shop to get some aluminium foil, a timetable for the theatre, and water. Can you believe it's already the fourth quarter? Let me grab my mobile phone and we'll be sorted.
Good morning! I'm from Britain and I quite enjoy having biscuits whilst watching films at the cinema. My favourite colour is grey and I drive on the motorway every day.
Water, aluminium, timetable, theatre, lift, flat, rubbish, holiday, trousers, mum, brilliant, rather, quite lovely indeed.
The British pronunciation includes words like aluminium instead of aluminum, and we say zed instead of zee for the letter Z.
I work for a company in the city centre and take the lift to the twentieth floor every morning for my job in advertising.
description: British English accent from the United Kingdom with Received Pronunciation characteristics and distinct vocabulary.
